main event: An unidentified flying object was observed over Canterbury, New Zealand in November 1954, described as balloon-shaped and motionless, then moving rapidly into a cloud.
interesting points: The object was tracked on ground radar for about 5 minutes before disappearing., It exhibited a different speed than a meteorological balloon released simultaneously., The primary observation came from members of the R.N.Z.A.F. under a watching operation., A civilian observation occurred at an altitude of approximately 40,000 feet., The report noted that the object emitted a white light without visible propulsion.
witness description: observed by R.N.Z.A.F. members and civilians
